sentence: Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) will begin trading ex-dividend on May 31, 2016.
A cash dividend payment of $0.69 per share is scheduled to be paid on June 16, 2016.
Shareholders who purchased HD prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 16.95% increase over the same period a year ago.
At the current stock price of $134.05, the dividend yield is 2.06%.
The previous trading day's last sale of HD was $134.05, representing a -2.74% decrease from the 52 week high of $137.82 and a 45.44% increase over the 52 week low of $92.17.
HD is a part of the Consumer Services sector, which includes companies such as Lowe's Companies, Inc. ( LOW ) and Sherwin-Williams Company ( SHW ).
HD's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $5.69.
Zacks Investment Research reports HD's forecasted earnings growth in 2017 as 16.48%, compared to an industry average of 28.5%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the HD Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
